t: Mark 13
Jesus Predicts the Destruction of the Temple
Then*p as He went out of the temple, one of His disciples said to Him, “Teacher, see what manner of stones and what buildings are*i here!”*i
And*p Jesus answered and said to him, “Do*r you*r see*r these*r great*r buildings?*r Not*r one*ir stone*r shall*r be*r left*r upon*r another,*r that*r shall*r not*r be*r thrown*r down.”*r
The Signs of the Times and the End of the Age
Now*p as He sat on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked Him privately,
“Tell us, when will these things be? And what will*i be*i the sign when all these things will be fulfilled?”
And*p Jesus, answering them, began to say: “Take*r heed*r that*r no*r one*r deceives*r you.*r
For*r many*r will*r come*r in*r My*r name,*r saying,*r ‘I*r am*r He,’*ir and*r will*r deceive*r many.*r
But*r when*r you*r hear*r of*r wars*r and*r rumors*r of*r wars,*r do*r not*r be*r troubled;*r for*r such*ir things*ir must*r happen,*r but*r the*r end*r is*ir not*r yet.*r

For*r nation*r will*r rise*r against*r nation,*r and*r kingdom*r against*r kingdom.*r And*r there*r will*r be*r earthquakes*r in*r various*r places,*r and*r there*r will*r be*r famines*r and*r troubles.*r These*r are*ir the*r beginnings*r of*r sorrows.*r

“But*rp watch*r out*r for*r yourselves,*r for*r they*r will*r deliver*r you*r up*r to*r councils,*r and*r you*r will*r be*r beaten*r in*r the*r synagogues.*r You*r will*r be*r brought*r before*r rulers*r and*r kings*r for*r My*r sake,*r for*r a*r testimony*r to*r them.*r
And*r the*r gospel*r must*r first*r be*r preached*r to*r all*r the*r nations.*r

But*r when*r they*r arrest*r you*ir and*r deliver*r you*r up,*r do*r not*r worry*r beforehand,*r or*r premeditate*r what*r you*r will*r speak.*r But*r whatever*r is*r given*r you*r in*r that*r hour,*r speak*r that;*r for*r it*r is*r not*r you*r who*r speak,*r but*r the*r Holy*r Spirit.*r
Now*r brother*r will*r betray*r brother*r to*r death,*r and*r a*r father*r his*ir child;*r and*r children*r will*r rise*r up*r against*r parents*r and*r cause*r them*r to*r be*r put*r to*r death.*r
And*r you*r will*r be*r hated*r by*r all*r for*r My*r name’s*r sake.*r But*r he*r who*r endures*r to*r the*r end*r shall*r be*r saved.*r
The Great Tribulation

“So*rp when*r you*r see*r the*r ‘abomination*r of*r desolation,’*r spoken*r of*r by*r Daniel*r the*r prophet,*r standing*r where*r it*r ought*r not”*r (let the reader understand), “then*r let*r those*r who*r are*r in*r Judea*r flee*r to*r the*r mountains.*r
Let*r him*r who*r is*r on*r the*r housetop*r not*r go*r down*r into*r the*r house,*r nor*r enter*r to*r take*r anything*r out*r of*r his*r house.*r
And*r let*r him*r who*r is*r in*r the*r field*r not*r go*r back*r to*r get*r his*r clothes.*r
But*r woe*r to*r those*r who*r are*r pregnant*r and*r to*r those*r who*r are*r nursing*r babies*r in*r those*r days!*r
And*r pray*r that*r your*r flight*r may*r not*r be*r in*r winter.*r

For*r in*ir those*r days*r there*r will*r be*r tribulation,*r such*r as*r has*r not*r been*r since*r the*r beginning*r of*r the*r creation*r which*r God*r created*r until*r this*r time,*r nor*r ever*r shall*r be.*r
And*r unless*r the*r Lord*r had*r shortened*r those*r days,*r no*r flesh*r would*r be*r saved;*r but*r for*r the*r elect’s*r sake,*r whom*r He*r chose,*r He*r shortened*r the*r days.*r
“Then*rp if*r anyone*r says*r to*r you,*r ‘Look,*r here*r is*ir the*r Christ!’*r or,*r ‘Look,*r He*ir is*ir there!’*r do*r not*r believe*r it.*r
For*r false*r christs*r and*r false*r prophets*r will*r rise*r and*r show*r signs*r and*r wonders*r to*r deceive,*r if*r possible,*r even*r the*r elect.*r
But*r take*r heed;*r see,*r I*r have*r told*r you*r all*r things*r beforehand.*r
The Coming of the Son of Man
“But*rp in*r those*r days,*r after*r that*r tribulation,*r the*r sun*r will*r be*r darkened,*r and*r the*r moon*r will*r not*r give*r its*r light;*r
the*r stars*r of*r heaven*r will*r fall,*r and*r the*r powers*r in*r the*r heavens*r will*r be*r shaken.*r
Then*r they*r will*r see*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r coming*r in*r the*r clouds*r with*r great*r power*r and*r glory.*r

And*r then*r He*r will*r send*r His*r angels,*r and*r gather*r together*r His*r elect*r from*r the*r four*r winds,*r from*r the*r farthest*r part*r of*r earth*r to*r the*r farthest*r part*r of*r heaven.*r
The Parable of the Fig Tree
“Now*rp learn*r this*r parable*r from*r the*r fig*r tree:*r When*r its*r branch*r has*r already*r become*r tender,*r and*r puts*r forth*r leaves,*r you*r know*r that*r summer*r is*r near.*r
So*r you*r also,*r when*r you*r see*r these*r things*r happening,*r know*r that*r it*r is*r near—at*r the*r doors!*r
Assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r this*r generation*r will*r by*r no*r means*r pass*r away*r till*r all*r these*r things*r take*r place.*r
Heaven*r and*r earth*r will*r pass*r away,*r but*r My*r words*r will*r by*r no*r means*r pass*r away.*r
No One Knows the Day or Hour
“But*rp of*r that*r day*r and*r hour*r no*r one*r knows,*r not*r even*r the*r angels*r in*r heaven,*r nor*r the*r Son,*r but*r only*r the*r Father.*r
Take*r heed,*r watch*r and*r pray;*r for*r you*r do*r not*r know*r when*r the*r time*r is.*r

It*ir is*ir like*r a*r man*r going*r to*r a*r far*r country,*r who*r left*r his*r house*r and*r gave*r authority*r to*r his*r servants,*r and*r to*r each*r his*r work,*r and*r commanded*r the*r doorkeeper*r to*r watch.*r

Watch*r therefore,*r for*r you*r do*r not*r know*r when*r the*r master*r of*r the*r house*r is*r coming—in*r the*r evening,*r at*r midnight,*r at*r the*r crowing*r of*r the*r rooster,*r or*r in*r the*r morning—*r
lest,*r coming*r suddenly,*r he*r find*r you*r sleeping.*r
And*r what*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r I*r say*r to*r all:*r Watch!”*r
